messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the temperature in Grand Canyon in Fahrenheit
I’m sorry, I don’t have real-time weather data available, so I can’t look up the current temperature at the Grand Canyon.
No worries. Maybe try finding it online or using a weather app?

I don’t have a way to fetch live weather information. For an up-to-the-minute temperature at the Grand Canyon, the quickest options are:

• Open a weather website or app (e.g., National Weather Service, Weather.com, or your phone’s built-in weather app)  
• Search “Grand Canyon weather” or look up the ZIP code 86023 (Grand Canyon Village)  
• If you need conditions at a specific rim or point (South Rim, North Rim, Phantom Ranch, etc.), many sites let you choose the exact location within the park.

If you’d like climatological averages instead—typical highs/lows by month, advice on what to expect at different elevations—let me know and I can provide those!
Thanks, but I don't have access to any app right now. Maybe you could check it for me?

I’m afraid I still don’t have a way to pull live weather data, so I can’t give you the exact, up-to-the-minute temperature. If you just need a ballpark figure or some context, here are a few useful reference points:

Typical February (South Rim / Grand Canyon Village, elevation ~7,000 ft)  
• Average daytime high: mid-40s °F (≈ 7 °C)  
• Average nighttime low: low-20s °F (≈ -6 °C)  
• Sudden snow showers are common, and temperatures can swing 30 °F (17 °C) in a single day.

Typical February (Inner Canyon / Phantom Ranch, elevation ~2,500 ft)  
• Average daytime high: mid-60s °F (≈ 18 °C)  
• Average nighttime low: mid-40s °F (≈ 7 °C)

If you do need the precise current reading, the quickest low-tech options are:

1. Call the Grand Canyon National Park information line (+1 928-638-7888) and follow the prompts for current South Rim weather.  
2. Dial 511 (if you’re in Arizona) and listen to the road-condition report, which often includes temperature and snow info for the South Rim.  
3. Use any phone capable of texting the National Weather Service’s “weather on demand” service (text a city name or ZIP—86023 for Grand Canyon Village—to  855-924-9910). They’ll text back the latest observation.

Let me know if you’d like more climate statistics, packing advice, or any other information about the Canyon!
I appreciate the detailed info. I'll figure it out, thanks!
You’re welcome! If any other questions come up—about the Grand Canyon, travel prep, or anything else—just let me know. Safe travels!
